channel.title: Few Questions
channel.description:
What programming language should I learn first (i'm into game development like runescape, a.v.a, etc). I know a little of html and css. Just web development doesn't interest me. I started learning blitz3d just to start knowing some basics of programming but I don't think it's a strong enough language to make a game like runescape or a.v.a.
Also what language should I learn for game development. C++ or Java? Which ones easier?
Also if this isn't the right spot, please remove. I'm new to the forums.

item.title: Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @IcyyEffect IcyyEffect
item.description:
@IcyyEffect wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:6, topic:455837”][quote author=IcyyEffect link=topic=558756.msg4085971#msg4085971 date=1345851815]
What programming language should I learn first (i’m into game development like runescape, a.v.a, etc). I know a little of html and css. Just web development doesn’t interest me. I started learning blitz3d just to start knowing some basics of programming but I don’t think it’s a strong enough language to make a game like runescape or a.v.a.

Also what language should I learn for game development. C++ or Java? Which ones easier?

Also if this isn’t the right spot, please remove. I’m new to the forums.
[/quote]

You should find java easier to learn than c++. Learning c++ should be easier to learn after knowing java, I hear(not in all scenarios). Vice versa too. You should look into python.

Also blitz3d is definitely the funnest basic language to use and you theoretically could create games “like runescape”. But its not a good way to learn programming at all, it will only hurt you. I spent my whole early teens messing with it and I could never pick up anything else.

So theres some advice from someone who doesn’t program anything :o[/quote]

Ye blitz3d is a gay language. I mean the syntax (if it’s right) is really weird o.O. Thanks I started learning java from the newboston really good guy.

Read full topic

item.title: Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“IcyyEffect, post:1, topic:455837”]What programming language should I learn first (i’m into game development like runescape, a.v.a, etc). I know a little of html and css. Just web development doesn’t interest me. I started learning blitz3d just to start knowing some basics of programming but I don’t think it’s a strong enough language to make a game like runescape or a.v.a.

Also what language should I learn for game development. C++ or Java? Which ones easier?

Also if this isn’t the right spot, please remove. I’m new to the forums.[/quote]

You should find java easier to learn than c++. Learning c++ should be easier to learn after knowing java, I hear(not in all scenarios). Vice versa too. You should look into python.

Also blitz3d is definitely the funnest basic language to use and you theoretically could create games “like runescape”. But its not a good way to learn programming at all, it will only hurt you. I spent my whole early teens messing with it and I could never pick up anything else.

So theres some advice from someone who doesn’t program anything :o

Read full topic

item.title: Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @Aetoc Aetoc
item.description:
@Aetoc wrote:

I find C# pretty good for game development with XNA and all.

Read full topic

item.title: Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @IcyyEffect IcyyEffect
item.description:
@IcyyEffect wrote:

t4:

C/C++, Java and C# are the go-to’s for game development. All of them have their strengths and weaknesses. C/C++ is usually considered harder for newcomers.

Alright thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

C/C++, Java and C# are the go-to’s for game development. All of them have their strengths and weaknesses. C/C++ is usually considered harder for newcomers.

Read full topic

item.title: Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I’m pretty sure it doesn’t matter which one you learn if you want to develop games

But some think that some are better than others.

Read full topic
